news_header: Over 20 spice products recalled due to potential peanut contamination not listed on labels.
news_text: The Food Standards Agency (FSA) has issued a precautionary recall of more than 20 spice products, including dips, curry powders, and seasonings, supplied by FGS Ingredients Ltd. The recall affects items such as Domino's BBQ Dip and various seasonings from Favourit and Dunnes Stores, as well as some sausages and burgers from Westmorland Family Butchery. This follows a previous recall related to possible peanut contamination, with ongoing investigations to determine the source. Consumers are advised to return the recalled products for a full refund, and point of sale notices will be displayed in stores to inform customers.
